1541833193_19HaBBc1M3usmLxayEasbaTkeZ3Tt.body:
Currently I am working on a project that does something similar.

There are issues around excepting payments using crypto.  One of the issues is that once a wallet is created and you use such to except payments anyone can see all the transactions if viewed on the Block chain. 

Creating new crypto wallets per transaction requires a program like Python to process all the data.
The other main issue is that you need to have a way to receive a form to except order and payment data.

A person can easily scan a QR code and pay you... however you have to still receive the order data to fill any orders which means everything must go to a data base / spreadsheet...  Also you need to associate the crypto payment with a specific individual along with their order data...

A database / JSON file can be used to except form data...  But the next issue is preventing individuals from spamming you...   Anything anonymous in terms of form submission means ANYONE can spam you...

So yes in theory you can except payment but you would need for the end user to run a .py script on their computer for the purpose of securing data.

Later,

> [thunder33345](#comment_318_1AHEQxyRG9s6owyJHShB4U4rg9GL5FMX5K): excuse me but crypto is 100% traceable, not much can be do this IS the property of blockchain, viewable to everyoneyou can get your way around by using multiple wallets address which you should as it's the industry standardthe thing that "sends" the crypto or "get an address to share" button to someone should be the thing that's responsible to shuffle the coins in multiple wallets, there should be no need for an extra program [...]

Actually been planing and developing for about 2-3 years...  EVERY aspect you touched on I have considered; FURTHERMORE, I have NOT explained HOW I am going about developing my program and payment method.

Before you jump to conclusions and make an issue of a persons ability understand everything about the subject...

I do NOT have the energy to explain every step on how a person can except crypto payments...

In theory anyone can setup a store on Zeronet...   however there would be restrictions...

1.)   Image of product or service
2.)   Short write up on item/service
3.)   QR code to the item/service
4.)    3rd party form handling / database as processing
         (spamming can be an issue...  however, some forms can be set to only allow 1 submission per person...)
         
Yes indeed using the same QR code / crypto account can be view able, but there is nothing stopping a person from updating them via Zeronet.

Using a Python program along side something like Zeronet where a person can download such and make payments seems to be the only way to securely process transactions.  The complexity is actually what stops a great many from developing a store.

Anytime you have an anonymous service that has a form submission there is NO way to prevent spamming to that submission form...   A third party form processing method that prevents spamming abuse is required... some only allow individuals to submit 1 time per form...

You can put an image of anything you wish to sell with a QR code with the proper amount of crypto right beside what you are selling...  The problem is keeping track of order information...  You can have people pay you but there is no way other then using a form submission method to keep track of content and shipping information...  Trying to do so purely on a website like Zeronet or a Blog website is extremely limited.   

Later,

> [thunder33345](#comment_320_1AHEQxyRG9s6owyJHShB4U4rg9GL5FMX5K): sorry i thought you meant by developing your OWN crypto blockchain rather then an "addon" plugin to zeronetback to your "spamming" concern, excuse me for not being able to fathom the "side effect", but what would happen if someone spammed someone else, what's the side effect?(edit: ah you ment spamming database related NOT spamming money) [...]

I understand your comment thunder33345.  No I am not creating a plugin, but the issues are very similar.

ZeroNet allows a command line line option to create and update a website...  Create a Zeronet site then place your files and folders within such...  the do a command line update to see your files...

Basically a block chain is a ledger and such does not actually hold much data...  it is NOT a file system, simply a pointer to the files...  The block chain is distributed but not the files...  For instance you can use IPFS and pin your data for up to 24 hours but after that the data is deleted...  the ledger still remains but the data is no longer...

Crypto payments really only hold the value and some allow for a very limited amount of text, but it is NOT a file system to store data...   The storage of data issue is currently being worked on by companies...  You can store some data to the block chain using bitcoin, I have seen an example but it is only a paragraph or less of text.

ZeroNet if they allow visitors to host their own data bas(es) of bought items / services running a python script in the background for processing purposes and share their .onion address with the seller...  The seller could simply get that data base and process their order(s)...  Seller has items, ZeroNet users visits their site clicks a link and copies their requested items / services via a data base from the seller with current prices etc...  ZeroNet user's script then creates a unique data base via their command line ZeroNet create function with it freshly created QR codes and cold wallet(s)...  If a web page with a form is pointing to the newly created data base it can be filled out and no one will spam their own data base...  So security issues is really not an issue...  The Seller would need to know the .onion address of the buyer to collect the order... makes sense?  ... perhaps the Seller would have to find a way for the buyer to submit their .onion address to reach their ZeroNet account...

Alternatively a python program can be created to handle all the processing like what I am working on currently.
.

1542598456_1LFfcgghoJPCrsJNw4rseWS1kSBth.body:
ZeroNet runs Tor in the background, there is nothing you need to do.

Standard web server using Tor
++++++++++++++++++++++++
Create a web server or ftp server and point your Tor settings to port 80.  In the process Tor will generate you a .onion address, that address will be on a Tor port, that is what you give others to visit via the Tor Browser.

ZeroNet distributes a website internally to those who visit a site and they become a host of that site...  The "blockchain" / ledger keeps track of the website address so that only a SINGLE address is needed to visit.

Suppose you have 10 individuals mirroring your website, using DNS you would have 10 different web addresses... 

A standard Tor website is not the same as a ZeroNet website...  If you web server is not available you tor address will not be on the Tor network...  Only a single person can host an .onion address, if a server is down or there is an issue with the internet connection even using the correct .onion address will fail...  The .onion address is not hosted on another location by default...   With ZeroNet if a persons computer / server goes down there are others who are mirroring your website, the difference is the SAME address is used to point to your website...  So you can have thousands of mirrors with only 1 ZeroNet address / .bit address.

Hope this helps...

Later,

ZeroNet is being developed for Android but for some reason it does not work for me on my Android phone.

You could download Orbot for Android... https://guardianproject.info/apps/orbot/

If you are able to install ZeroNet on your phone / tablet simply install Orbot and point it to your 127.0.0.1:80 for example...

Later,  :)

1542675872_13fF8ReM7zvX4ytjPkwEaRtBbtFKe.body:
> [thunder33345](#comment_333_1AHEQxyRG9s6owyJHShB4U4rg9GL5FMX5K): funny thing is you cant delete it, once you release something into zeronet it's there and forever....deleting it deletes it off your drive, but not mine and other countless peers

Actually if you are the owner YES you can delete the content.   For example If I made a revision to my timelinehyperbot.bit site and republish it everything within my ZeroNet directory for my site will update.

And NO when you publish to ZeroNet as an owner of the content can be deleted, it is NOT permanent!

The ZeroNet address RESEMBLES a blockchain but it is NOT...

Content when republished automatically gets updated on all peers...

Suppose I create a site using the prompt command, it would follow in this way...

1.)  Create site
2.)  Create content...  Go to the ZeroNet folder for the newly created site & KEY.
3.)  When in the newly created site folder ADD a index.html, text file, and even new directory called test
4.)   Update your site using your PRIVATE KEY...
 
a.)      D:\ZeroNet-TimeLineHyperBot\lib\zeronet.cmd siteCreate                   <<<<< Creates 

** The above command does the following below...

- Generating new privatekey...
- ----------------------------------------------------------------------
- Site private key: xFKRsHj4bnajKR6eYySnuXeiO6HYW6UuP997lxdxcz63VjyhtSB      <<< Changed, not my site's
-                   !!! ^ Save it now, required to modify the site ^ !!!
- Site address:     1FUZX5q3YshUGRT95WzCCLrhwFqS3pdPSx
- ----------------------------------------------------------------------


How can I modify a ZeroNet site?
++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++

Modify files located in data/1FUZX5q3YshUGRT95WzCCLrhwFqS3pdPSx directory. After you're finished:

Publish:
++++++++
D:\ZeroNet-TimeLineHyperBot\lib\zeronet.cmd siteSign 1FUZX5q3YshUGRT95WzCCLrhwFqS3pdPSx

Will ask for the site private key: 
xFKRsHj4bnajKR6eYySnuXeiO6HYW6UuP997lxdxcz63VjyhtSB

*** Note:  Copy and paste your private key in is the easy way...  Keep in mind when you paste your private key that it will NOT show / display at prompt...  This is for security reasons... So you can copy and paste at the command line but you will not see the private key ...  >>> SIMPLY PRESS ENTER  <<<   ... Windows can sometimes be a little tricky when it comes to copy and paste for some reason...

After you publish you can re publish using the above method...

Simply change the file(s) and folder(s) within your ZeroNet folder / directory and 

RE-Publish:
++++++++
D:\ZeroNet-TimeLineHyperBot\lib\zeronet.cmd siteSign 1FUZX5q3YshUGRT95WzCCLrhwFqS3pdPSx

Will ask for the site private key: 
xFKRsHj4bnajKR6eYySnuXeiO6HYW6UuP997lxdxcz63VjyhtSB


>>> SO NO ZERONET CONTENT IS NOT PERMANENT <<<

Later,  :)

1542892944_1HiF6gUThBQQqghUPLxc7h2uupMJx.body:
It is easier to use the command prompt to create a site, add file(s) / modify file(s), create directories / folders, and include misc content like videos, audio, flat data base.

ZeroNet hashes everything... So it is not as easy to simply move stuff and expect everything to work...

Instead after you make modifications to your site, you need to sign using your PRIVATE KEY.  After you republish ZeroNet will re make all your important files to have the proper hash(es) and files.

Cloned sites for some reason acts strange.

Create site creates a folder, example:   1HiF6gUThBQQqghUPLxc7h2uupMJxwGbzj

A PRIVATE KEY is generated ...  WRITE IT DOWN OR COPY AND PASTE IT TO YOUR DESKTOP AND MAKE A HARD COPY !!!

Go to that directory and move some files there or simply create a test.txt file...

NEXT...  you NEED to SIGN / re publish your whole site... 1HiF6gUThBQQqghUPLxc7h2uupMJxwGbzj    for example.

You will be prompted to enter your PRIVATE KEY, make sure you do NOT confuse this key with other keys!

Keep in mind that PRIVATE KEY is associated with only that 1HiF6gUThBQQqghUPLxc7h2uupMJxwGbzj site...  If you remake a ZeroNet site that private key will NOT work!  ....  If this is the case you find yourself in re create your site.

I had issues with cloned sites, but when I learned to use the command line ZeroNet commands I understood much easier what was going on!

Later,

1542961064_1NPtYVgoahStC1NUHZZJe3JdzcccX.body:
I have been working on this problem...


Distributing a file / program is fairly easy, but having the PEERS and SEED is another issue.


Intergalactic File Server can host your file and create a link to that file from ZeroNet as it will be required!


The problem with the distributed applications is excepting payment...  If you attach your program to any 3rd party you HAVE to follow their rules and regulations as well as any rules an regulations that 3rd party service has imposed on it by other companies / governments.


As long as you have to depend on another service there will ALWAYS be problems!


1.  Sharing files and programs is fairly easy...  host file and link to such
2.   Excepting Crypto payment is fairly easy...  Create a QR code with the amount expected.
3.   Displaying an image of an item or service is fairly easy with the QR code beside it...
4.   Creating a JAVA script shopping cart is not too hard


*** Processing the order is the hard part, you need to associate the amount you receive in crypto to what is being sold and the quantity...  Essentially you would need an HTML form that submits your order data to a NON-decentralized server...  This becomes problematic as you would need to follow 3rd party rules and regulations. 


Hackers WILL spam HTML forms, this is a HUGE problem!...   What this means is that a 3rd party / company has to be used.   Unless you use TOR hidden service (web server) AND some way to reduce or prevent your HTML form from being spammed you have a REAL issue.


If you are using a program written in Python for example you can create a self contained order system RATHER then using a typical web page to take and process orders...  Also you can generate UNIQUE crypto wallets for every order...  All data get encrypted and made into a block of text that gets sent... perhaps via EMAIL ...  Protonmail seems the best way...  There will be a manual component for the processing of orders...


I was initially thinking using Google Forms would be a good solution... but buyers wound NEED a gmail account to prevent spamming to a google form...   Some people do NOT like Google!  ...  I thought if #Mentions could be sent with 280 chars to my Twitter account then that would be fine, but the problem is that Twitter is a BS company who disables accounts for BS reasons and tells long term users to F off...   As well as requiring everyone to submit their cellular phone numbers...  Talking about PUSHY!


Perhaps sending data to a ZeroNet  ZeroTalk cloned site that gets "scraped" by a Python program is an alternative.  For a PC user this could be done but the sending of data from the program / app would need a reverse API to be created or at lest access to the web form through ZeroTalk clone.

1543348094_16VrCKQQiVZpJ6S5xJASR8LCFLv24.body:
A came across ZeroNet about 2 years ago but there was not enough nodes available to mirror my site...  I didn't get the overall idea but I get it now!   1 ZeroNet address can point to MANY different locations, if a single node (computer) is down that address still points to the correct data on another persons computer.


IPFS for instance does not work the same way as ZeroNet does...  To run IPFS for example you need to run a dedicated server that can be reached, if that server goes down you will not be able to get to the data or website.


The old issue of DNS is actually the REAL issue in question...  How do I know where to connect and will that connection still remain solid and not change on me...


DNS = pointer to webserver


A DNS or Dynamic DNS allows for the IP of a computer / network system keep a domain attached...   Also for individuals who setup a personal server a Dynamic DNS simply updates your current IP address if and when it changes...   This method of tracking where a server location is centralized.


So the idea of using a ledger / block chain was used to keep track of where a computer was located...  It is intended to replace DNS to some extent...  However domain names depend on a centralized network + DNS to function...


So logically the fist thought is using IPFS, this is fine if you have a stable and dedicated server / network...  But if you are an individual this is NOT good enough...  If your server goes down that data is NOT reachable!  ...  A corporation can mirror and redirect traffic but again this is temporary...  24 hours is the maximum you can pin data to the IPFS block chain... after that it gets purged.   So if you think you can upload a website or files to the IPFS and think you will be able to reach it beyond a day or two you would be wrong...


Block chain is only a ledger functioning similarly to a DNS server were everyone simply by default views the same ledger to locate a file or website...  the ledger is distributed amount those who use it...  but keep in mind that ledger / block chain that everyone shares has a limit on its size...  So storing data on it simply is not realistic... 


A lot of people do not understand that you do NOT store data to a ledger / block chain such is only a pointer to where your files are stored on a standard web server, distributed or not...


ZeroNet fixes a great many issues...   A distributed system to mirror sites and files...  Share my site by visiting and I will visit your site and we can mirror each other content...  If you don't like my content for any number of reasons delete such...  If you have 20 visitors who like your content they will mirror your site and you will have your content almost always available to any one who visits your site...  That is cool...   Even more cool then IPFS by itself!
  
Later,

The .Dat (Beakerbrowser) has some benefits over ZeroNet in some ways; HOWEVER, ZeroNet is a better option.

A community of users are required to host / mirror a website to always make a copy available for viewers of your website...  This is problematic if there is no one hosting your required files for your website.  There is a seed option available for the .Dat websites, but it is a commercially controlled service...  They pick and choose what THEY feel is except able...   You could create a .dat website and share it or have the files made available and tell people to point their browser to a URL hosting your file...  OR... have a computer acting like a server, keeping a node available...  Due to the general lack of people the Beakerbrowser concept breaks down...  On the other hand if you wanted to make a truly private market place you could create a very simple list of items each with a QR code for a Bitcoin wallet with the amount of the item in Bitcoin...  You would need to calculate the amount of Bitcoin from USD to Bitcoin for example...   Image of item for sale along with a simple write up and to the right of that a single QR code...  and repeat the process... You get the idea... :)  ... It is not a perfect solution but it can work...  Monthly change your .Dat website and use unique QR codes / wallets... You WILL need to have a html form to process the order data, but NOT the actual receiving of payment...   A person can use their cellphone to scan the QR code for each item and pay manually... OR... if they are viewing your .data website on their cellphone they can click on the URL of the QR code and let their cellphone crypto app handle their payment...   Yet again you need the data from the html form for the processing of the order but not to accept payment if you are looking to create a secret market place...  ;)

You can do the very same thing using ZeroNet, a simple program can be easily created using Python to process order data...  Creating PRIVATE crypto wallets and having your buyers fund those wallets THEN send you the private key(s) to pay for their orders seem an alternative way to do private transactions... Keep in mind encryption can be done fairly easily!   :)

I'm not sure if you are trying to rant or do not understand my point.

ZeroNet is decentralized, when someone visits they also host your site...
Beakerbrowser (.dat website) needs to be online or someone hosting it...

The two sound a like but are actually different...  ZeroNet has a community of people who are continually being introduced to your ZeroNet site and once they visit they also host your site...   Beaker by default does not have a seed, rather you need to go to a commercially controlled site where THEY deiced if they will act as the super seed to make your .dat site available...   This sound fair but consider this how do people find your .dat site to re host it in the first place...   If you introduce running a Blog website on a regular style website and point people to your .dat website then the whole process is self defeating... why use the .dat website...   So then you say well I have just created a website and need to host it because once I'm off line my site is not available...   Well for a private site this might be ok if you only have a few friends visiting once and a while but to have a stable .dat site your computer needs to be online 24/7 and others NEED to have the interest to also act as seeds...  Between the lack of traffic and asking people to host on their own computer which they also turn off you have a situation where your .data website is NOT available...   The super seed option via the Beakerbrowser website... forgot the name of it, sry...  can be signed up for but there are a tun of conditions...   If you are considering something in terms of a website that is conservative, political, open thought, and or a commercial website such can be declined to be hosted on the super seed...   ZeroNet does not really have these problems, perhaps in early days...

np, I thought initially that Beakerbrowser was an excellent idea as well as IPFS...  I have looked at how I could host a simple website that was either on a blockchain or distributed via a network...  I had learned that such was not nearly as simple as what a great many people claim.

I REALLY like the idea of Beakerbrowser and it certainly has its place...  Suppose you want to sell an item or items to an individual that was targeted to that person...  In theory if you knew how to create crypto wallets and QR codes for such you in theory could if you had buyers for a product and or service send them a different copy of your website so that purchases could be made easily...  But that means individuals would need to contact you directly and leave their contact information...  Then perhaps you could generate from a template a unique .dat website using something like Python...  What that means is that every item could have a unique Bitcoin, Litecoin, and or Etherium wallet for every item...  A QR code can be created...  They simply send the PRIVATE KEY of the wallet to the seller via a web form or perhaps an email address...  protonmail or throw away email address is perhaps useful...  If you require your buyers to download a small registration software displaying items within such you would not need to have a website to sell from rather a Python program / frozen binary..

More and more I had looked at both Beakerbrowser and ZeroNet more I saw that form processing was lacking...  It is not that you cannot create web forms for both, rather all data would be public to see...   Suppose I wanted to create a web form on either one and I tell you to fill out a web from, without server side processing using PHP you could NOT send me data...  It would mean that you would need to be authorized to change a file or database on my end...  If you wanted to publish something using ZeroNet you NEED to sign for it...   But you could NOT sign for data which was sent to me for example, such is NOT possible...   I could create a forum on ZeroNet and you and I could send data via such, BUT that would NOT be private...  Perhaps if you and I encrypted the data in a private folder within a ZeroNet data folder and we both used something like Python / Pycryptodome to read the URL(s) you and I could for example simply update our own file(s) which the other person reads...  Yet again you could NOT sign to publish content on my end, or could I do the same on my end...   There is a fair amount of complexity...

In my opinion both Beakerbrower and ZeroNet should simple be a jump point to introduce content with the viewers downloading a signup program.  There would be no requirement for PHP to run if you are using something like Python...   There is a web portal for ZeroNet for example my site....

https://0net.io/1FUZX5q3YshUGRT95WzCCLrhwFqS3pdPSx/

So if you wanted to have a decentralized website open to the regular web you could...  Download a registration software seems useful...   The PHP and server side BS can end and a more decentralized method can go more common place...


What do you think?

> [nws](#comment_6_1b4WB9mZcpjKdQUnYvGBgTMeatTxXTBnf): You're right that Dat is file-focused, but with Beakerbrowser it seems just as suitable to publish websites as ZeroNet is. Or is there a fundamental difference?

Yes there is a fundamental difference...  Traffic of people who would initially come across your content.  If no one see your .dat website as there is NO community of people who are simple just checking out new stuff it becomes a REAL issue...  With a .dat website the other people who visit do not automatically mirror / seed your site...  Your computer needs to be on 24/7...  

HashBase acts like a SUPER SEED, but keep in mind that is a COMMERCIALLY controlled setup...  You need to follow a VERY strict set of rules and regulations...  HashBase basically is acting like a web server which also seeds the .dat files of your website.   If HashBase deciedes that you BROKE their rules, terms, arbitrary decisions, and data limits your MAIN seed goes down...  This means NO one will be able to get to your website UNLESS you have a dedicated seed...  Even then, for what I understand, the seeding of .dat files is .torrent based meaning even if you have seeds such may not be enough for everyone to see / access your .dat website...

ZeroNet handles the above issues by simply making all viewers of a ZeroNet website a server / seed and if someone does not want to follow they simply delete / remove that visited site....  It is not perfect but solves the above issues...  

ZeroNet strictly speaking does NOT use Blockchain...   But does use a ledger system and in may way is superior in file management and easy of usage.   The main problem with ZeroNet is that you cannot create PRIVATE accounts where the data is safe...  You can include a .py file within your ZeroNet folder of your site then update your site and get the url / address and download then run it if you have python installed on your computer...  But that is a potential security issue even if you have a really good virus software as developers can put nearly anything into that code.

Even a virtual machine running software in not fully safe...  But again people download software mostly because they trust the sources...   One on one via sales and or technical support is a way to build trust.

Yes and no robione... I get your point and it does make sense!...  However you would need to run a python script or full program to process the form...  ZeroNet would need to create an API... 

Suppose I create a regular website with a simple html form...   Suppose I get the correct code together to allow that form to send such to the ZeroMail address everyone and their dog can spam that ZeroMail address...   Only a registration system that is private seems to be useful...  Yes the ZeroMail is encrypted on both sides but the ZeroMail address is unprotected and can be spammed!

My ZeroMail account has already been spammed once! ... 

If a person registered an account and that file remains within their own ZeroNet directory and the other person get a ZeroNet url to that data then perhaps that would work... But keep in mind you would need to always SIGN for that data...  The issue with not having a PRIVATE system is that email and other 3rd party processing is required...

I can create a Google Form very easily and associate a Google Spreadsheet and publish such as a html page that has a URL...   Also...  With Google Forms you can set such to only allow 1 submission per person...   This helps to cut down spamming...   If something like that can be created for ZeroNet then that would simplify everything...

ZeroNet is a Python program but for what I understand individuals do not have access to run .py or pyc scripts...  If ZeroNet allowed for users to opt in or out of using scripts that would be great...

I can place a .py or pyc file within my ZeroNet directory and link my html code to that but that would only download that file... The end user would need to have Python installed on their system...

If ZeroNet allowed Python Scripts that would be good but could cause security issues...   But again people download programs and run such anyways but use a virus scanner / firewall...
nws ... ZeroMail is encrypted but that does not protect you from spammers...

Yes, I am running into that issue bringing my Gab bot into the market place.


When we talk about decentralized systems like ZeroNet but exclude the freedom of using custom coding a quick realization comes very quickly that we have limits set on us...   ZeroNet does have an API but to a Python programmer such is EXTREMELY limiting.   On the other hand ZeroNet needs to protect it's user base and a wide open Python environment is also not a good idea as misc dangerous code can be ran, also not good!   ...  ZeroNet would take on a huge liability and trust in the overall ZeroNet system would be greatly limited or even totally lost...


Ultimately creating modular systems is required along with something like ZeroNet...  A module or independence program / app can be installed separately pointing the the correct file location within a ZeroNet user folder...   The benefit of this is that a user can un install such from their computer, cell phone, and or tablet.  Such can also be scanned by a virus / security scanner.


Even the PRIVATE KEY can be scanned in by the software but signing such is required under the ZeroNet system.  It is actually fairly complex...


Dynamic content that can except a web form needs PHP processing which is server side.  If you are trying to take orders for a product or service this is VERY problematic. 


Try creating a simple shopping cart under ZeroNet...  You can create a simple one using Javascript but submitting such requires PHP or server side scripting, such does not work for client end processing...  Perhaps the ONLY way I know how such can be down is having orders sent to an email address...  Providing the email servers allow for an un secure connection.... Spam can be an issue. 


My program when completed will generate a cold storage wallet to be funded via the PUBLIC KEY (QR Code) and the buyer would simply scan in the QR code and allow their cell phone software, most likely coinbase account to fund the proper amount...   Then my program will send me the PRIVATE KEY so I can receive payment...  After payment has been received the product or service can be processed, mailed out, or a software link can be provided.


Keep in mind suppose you want to sell stuff excepting crypto as payment is actually a good concept! ... Hosting a site on ZeroNet makes it much harder for someone to arbitrarily shut down your site for either political or for commercial interests that are hostile to your product and or service...   Setting up a "Black Market Place" to sell standard legal items and services is in my opinion a good idea as the Sellers have a stable market place that is very hard to shut down...   If you were selling t-shirts and a competitor complained or got trolls and or black hat hackers to damage your rep or attack your website such is a very bad thing...  Try doing that with ZeroNet and the ability to generate cold storage wallets to sell items...  Coinbase will only see unique crypto wallets per every transaction and nothing else plus onlookers to the PUBLIC wallet address would not see very much transactions...  Excepting payments MUST also be accompanied by a web form's shopping cart data to define items, quantities, and misc data to complete an order...   sending an email with such data is fairly easy...  Proton mail and throw away email accounts could also be used, but knowing the throw away email address would need to be collected first if that option was picked...


This was my conclusion in setting up a business website...  Show images of my program and allow the individual to register via my program...  After they register via my program a QR code to Bitcoin, Litecoin, and Etherium would be generated so the buyer could scan such with their cell phone OR simply click on a hyperlink if they are using a PC so their PC crypto software could fund one of those accounts...  A wait of up to 12 hours will happen but both the payment and order data can be received fairly easily,  even if only by email to retrieve the order data by a html or txt file.


What do you think?
